column4: does anyone know how to bring up the volume gui for multimedia keys ????? pls help
go to system, Preferences and then keyboard shortcuts
i have, however i need the command line for it
no, do u have volume control bound to a certain keyboard combination ?
no, i have it bound to only one key
when u hit that key, a gui appears telling showing u the volume level i need to be able to control that gui

yas thats correct that is the gui im talking about. Now i have a remote control and i already have the button controlling the volume, however im wondering if can bring up that gui, because u can set a keyboard key to activate the command
i would like to find out what command is being run when i hit that key
so i can use that command within the remotes configuration file
oh... you can just set it using lirc i think
ive been searching ? damn that would be great if u could but haven't been able to
haha, ok say if you have the key "Ctr + G" set to volume up.
gnome must execute a command once ctr g is hit to bring up that Volume GUi, i would like that command ?? comprende ? soz
